newsitem.title: USA: IBM cuts prices on two network printers.
newsitem.headline: IBM cuts prices on two network printers.

text.p: International Business Machines Corp. Thursday cut U.S. prices on two models of its network printers by up to nearly 20 percent.
IBM's network printer 12 is now 19 percent cheaper at $1,299, vs. $1,599 previously. The price of its network printer 24 has been cut 14 percent to $2,999 from $3,499.
The Armonk, N.Y.-based company also said it cut the price of its toner catridge for its network printer 24 by 15 percent to $219 from $257.50.
IBM also said it released its network printer manager software for open-standards network printers.
The software allows customers to install and monitor network printers through an intranet using desktop Web browsers and can be downloaded for free from the IBM printing systems home page.
IBM's stock fell $1.375 to $173.75 on the New York Stock Exchange at midday.
